column100:
Do you want to join a rapidly expanding team? And do you want to focus on developing audio signal processing in products? If you can contribute with experience in product development and embedded programming, then you might be the person EPOS are looking for! 
   
 Every day, thousands of people make calls, play games, or listen to music with one of EPOS’ best-in-class headsets. Software has become paramount to their sound quality, and digital signal processing is at the heart of the development of headsets. With EPOS’ continuous growth, they are looking for even more DSP Engineers to join their Digital Signal Processing team. 
   
 Join a growing team!  
 You will be part of a highly skilled and fast-paced team responsible for delivering both innovation and best-in-class headset quality. EPOS’ Digital Signal Processing team is part of the Software development department with expertise in Digital Signal Processing, Embedded software, Software Test and Mobile, PC and Cloud applications. At EPOS, they work in cross-functional project teams, and you will therefore daily interface with Acoustic, Software and Hardware Engineers. 
   
 You will focus on developing products through all project phases, from specification through design, implementation, and test.  
   
 Your main responsibilities will include: 
 
 Contribute to the development of new audio products 
 Development of audio algorithms in products 
 MIPS, memory, and power optimization 
 Algorithm tuning tools 
 Porting of algorithm 
 
 Solid Digital Signal Processing skills  
 EPOS are looking to hire DSP engineers with an agile and communicative mindset.  
   
 On the technical side, the ideal candidate meets the following requirements: 
 
 Relevant M.Sc. degree and minimum 3 years of experience 
 Experience with embedded programming in Assembler, C or C++ is a necessity to succeed in the role 
 Experience with low-power, MIPS and memory optimization 
 Experience with wireless communication, acoustics and/or audio algorithms 
 
   
 Joining the team and EPOS 
 EPOS is an audio and video solution company developing and selling devices for business professionals and the gaming community.  Based on leading and advanced technologies, the Danish founded company delivers high-end audio and video solutions with design, technology and performance as paramount parameters. 
   
 The establishment of EPOS is based on the decision to let the business segments of the joint venture – known as Sennheiser Communications – between Sennheiser Electronic GmbH & Co. KG and Demant A/S evolve in different set-ups. Alongside the introduction of a new own-branded portfolio, EPOS continues to design, manufacture and sell the current Sennheiser Communications portfolio co-branded as EPOS I SENNHEISER. 
 EPOS is part of the Demant Group – a world-leading audio and hearing technology group. As such, it builds on more than 115 years of experience of working with innovation and sound. 
   
 With headquarters in Copenhagen, Denmark, EPOS operates in a global market with offices and partners in more than 30 countries. Find more information at  www.eposaudio.com 
 Interested? 
 The recruitment process is handled by mpeople on behalf of EPOS. If you have any questions about the position or EPOS, please get in touch with Birgitte Vilsgaard on bgv@mpeople.dk or  +45 28 18 18 91 
 We look forward to hearing from you. 
   
 #jobsforukraine
